com.yantra.yfc.util

Class YFCDate

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Date
      • java.sql.Timestamp
        • com.yantra.yfc.util.YFCDate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.yantra.yfc.util.YFCKeyedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.util.Date>

    public class YFCDate
extends java.sql.Timestamp
implements com.yantra.yfc.util.YFCKeyedObject
    Date/Timestamp object used by an application. 2.0 Direct use of this class is discouraged. Use YDate instead
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      This is a special date to signify situations when date is in past and is unknown.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      YFCDate()
      This constructor allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the time at which it was allocated, measured to the nearest millisecond.
      YFCDate(boolean ignoreTime)
      This constructor gets the current date from the System and changes the hour, minute, second and millisecond to zero.
      YFCDate(java.util.Date aDate)
      This constructor converts a Date object to a YFCDate object and includes the current time.
      YFCDate(java.util.Date aDate, boolean ignoreTime)
      This constructor converts the Date object to a YFCDate.
      YFCDate(long aMillis)
      This constructor converts a time stamp object provided in milliseconds to YFCDate.
      YFCDate(long aMillis, boolean ignoreTime)
      This constructor converts a time stamp object provided in milliseconds to YFCDate.
      YFCDate(java.lang.String aStrDate)
      This constructor tries to parse aStrDate in the format, yyyyMMddHHmmss and returns the YFCDate.
      YFCDate(java.lang.String aStrDate, java.lang.String inFormat, boolean ignoreTime)
      This constructor tries to parse the string date to a format of yyyyMMddHHmmss and returns the the YFCDate.
      YFCDate(java.lang.String aStrDate, YFCLocale aLocale)
      This constructor tries to parse the string aStrDate in the locale specified by the YFCLocale object.
      YFCDate(java.lang.String aStrDate, YFCLocale aLocale, boolean ignoreTime)
      This constructor tries to parse the String aStrDate in the locale specified in YFCLocale object).

    • Field Detail

      • APP_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String APP_FORMAT
        The format used by toString method. This format is used when the locale is not known. This is mostly used while coding.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • XML_DATE_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String XML_DATE_FORMAT
        The format for date field used in both the input and output XML by the API's. As of 6.0, the ISO_DATETIME_FORMAT should be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SMALL_XML_DATE_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String SMALL_XML_DATE_FORMAT
        The format for the date component. This same as the basic date format of ISO-8601. As of 6.0, the ISO_DATE_FORMAT should be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ISO_DATETIME_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String ISO_DATETIME_FORMAT
        The International Standard Organization's (ISO) numeric representation of date and time. The format is as follows. Exactly the components shown here must be present, with exactly this punctuation. Note that the "T" appears literally in the string, to indicate the beginning of the time element, as specified in ISO. If the "T" is not mentioned in the string, only the date part of the string will be considered and the time part will be ignored.
        YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOW_DATE

        public static YFCDate LOW_DATE
        This is a special date to signify situations when date is in past and is unknown. This field uses the Date object with the value of date as 01/01/1900 (January 01, 1900).

      • HIGH_DATE

        public static YFCDate HIGH_DATE
        This is a special date to signify situations when date is in the future and is unknown. This high date is used by applications with the data value as 01/01/2500 (January 01, 2500).

    • Constructor Detail

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate()
        This constructor allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the time at which it was allocated, measured to the nearest millisecond. The YFCDate constructor gets the current date and time from the System object.

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate(boolean ignoreTime)
        This constructor gets the current date from the System and changes the hour, minute, second and millisecond to zero. ignoreTime When true, the time component of a date is ignored. The time is set to 00:00:00.

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate(java.lang.String aStrDate,
               YFCLocale aLocale)
        This constructor tries to parse the string aStrDate in the locale specified by the YFCLocale object. If the string date can be parsed, it returns the string date in the format of the YFCLocale. If the string cannot be parsed the current date is returned. aStrDate Date String to be parsed. aLocale YFCLocale defining the date format of the string passed.

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate(java.lang.String aStrDate,
               YFCLocale aLocale,
               boolean ignoreTime)
        This constructor tries to parse the String aStrDate in the locale specified in YFCLocale object). If the string can be parsed, it returns the aStrDate in the format of the YFCLocale. If the string cannot be parsed the current date is returned. It finally strips the time component and makes it zero if ignoreTime is set to True. aStrDate Date String to be parsed. aLocale YFCLocale defining the date format of the string passed. ignoreTime When true, the time component of a date is ignored. The time is set to 00:00:00.

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate(java.lang.String aStrDate)
        This constructor tries to parse aStrDate in the format, yyyyMMddHHmmss and returns the YFCDate. aStrDate Date String to be parsed.

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate(java.lang.String aStrDate,
               java.lang.String inFormat,
               boolean ignoreTime)
        This constructor tries to parse the string date to a format of yyyyMMddHHmmss and returns the the YFCDate. This constructor checks whether the format is as defined by the ISO date time format along with the length of the string date. aStrDate Date String to be parsed. inFormat The input format of the string date. ignoreTime When true, the time component of a date is ignored. The time is set to 00:00:00.

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate(java.util.Date aDate)
        This constructor converts a Date object to a YFCDate object and includes the current time. aDate Date object

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate(long aMillis)
        This constructor converts a time stamp object provided in milliseconds to YFCDate. If the time stamp is in milliseconds then the YFCDate returned is after January 1, 1970 00:00:00 GMT. When the input is a negative value then a date before January 1, 1970 00:00:00 GMT is returned. aMillis The time stamp in milliseconds.

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate(long aMillis,
               boolean ignoreTime)
        This constructor converts a time stamp object provided in milliseconds to YFCDate. If the time stamp is in milliseconds then the YFCDate returned is after January 1, 1970 00:00:00 GMT. When the input is a negative value then a date before January 1, 1970 00:00:00 GMT is returned. If the ignoreTime is set to True then the time component is removed. aMillis The time stamp in milliseconds. ignoreTime When true, the time component of a date is ignored. The time is set to 00:00:00.

      • YFCDate

        public YFCDate(java.util.Date aDate,
               boolean ignoreTime)
        This constructor converts the Date object to a YFCDate. If the ignoreTime is set to True then the time component is removed. aDate The Date object. ignoreTime When true, the time component of a date is ignored. The time is set to 00:00:00.

    • Method Detail

      • setDate

        public void setDate(java.lang.String aStrDate,
                    java.lang.String inFormat,
                    boolean ignoreTime)
        The setDate method tries to parse aStrDate to Date object using the input format passed and sets the date, if ignore time is set to false. This method does not take the timezone into account. Construct a new YTimestamp instead. aStrDate Date String to be parsed. inFormat The input format of the string date. ignoreTime When true, the time component of a date is ignored. The time is set to 00:00:00.

      • setDate

        public void setDate(YFCDate aDate)
        This method uses the YFCDate object to set the date. aDate Date String to be parsed.

      • setDate

        public void setDate(YFCDate aDate,
                    boolean ignoreTime)
        This method uses the YFCDate object to set the date and strips the time if ignoreTime is set to True. aDate Date String to be parsed. ignoreTime When true, the time component of a date is ignored. The time is set to 00:00:00.

      • setDate

        public void setDate(java.lang.String longValue,
                    boolean ignoreTime)
        This setDate method sets the date to be equal to the date specified in the input string longValue. This method parses it to a long integer value based on the setting of the ignore time. longValue The input date string to be parsed as a long integer. ignoreTime When true, the time component of a date is ignored. The time is set to 00:00:00.

      • removeTimeComponent

        public final void removeTimeComponent()
        The removeTimeComponent method makes the time part of the variable to 0.

      • diffDays

        public final int diffDays(YFCDate t2)
        The diffdays method outputs the difference in days without considering the time portions of the date. t2 The input YFCDate object. An integer representing the difference in days.

      • getNewDate

        public YFCDate getNewDate(int aDays)
        The getNewDate method returns a new YFCDate object after changing the input by supplied number of days. It leaves the current date unchanged. aDays An integer representing the number of days. A YFCDate object.

      • changeDate

        public void changeDate(int aDays)
        This method adds the number of days, aDays to the YFCDate object. aDays The input integer representing the number of days.

      • applyTimeZone

        public final void applyTimeZone(com.ibm.icu.util.TimeZone fromTz,
                                com.ibm.icu.util.TimeZone toTz)
        The applyTimeZone method assumes YFCDate object to be in the from TimeZone, and converts it to the toTimeZone. This method basically adds or subtracts a few hours to and from the timezone provided. fromTz The apply from timezone. toTz The apply to timezone.

      • gte

        public final boolean gte(YFCDate t2,
                         boolean ignoreTime)
        This method returns True if the current time is greater than or equal to input YFCDate t2. Consider time to see if time portion should be ignored. t2 Compared date. ignoreTime When true, time is not compared. True if this date is >= to the passed YFCDate.

      • lte

        public final boolean lte(YFCDate t2,
                         boolean ignoreTime)
        This method returns True if the current time is less than or equal to input YFCDate t2. Consider time to see if time portion should be ignored. t2 Compared date. ignoreTime When true, time is not compared. True if this date is <= to the passed YFCDate.

      • lt

        public final boolean lt(YFCDate t2,
                        boolean ignoreTime)
        This method return True if the current time is less than the input YFCDate t2. Consider time to see if time portion should be ignored. t2 Compared date. ignoreTime When true, time is not compared. True if this date is < to the passed YFCDate.

      • gt

        public final boolean gt(YFCDate t2,
                        boolean ignoreTime)
        This method return True if the current time is greater than the input YFCDate t2. Consider time to see if time portion should be ignored. t2 Compared date. ignoreTime When true, time is not compared.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String aOutFormat)
        This method returns YFCDate in this format : "yyyyMMdd'T'HH:mm:ss". This method is provided for backward compatibility. aOutFormat The string format for the date object.

                                  java.util.Locale aLcl)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns the date and time in string type, in the "yyyyMMddHHmmss" format. A formatted string when the locale format is not provided.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.sql.Timestamp

      • setBeginOfDay

        public void setBeginOfDay()
        This method sets the beginning time of day by making the time part to 0. This is similar to the removeTimeComponent method.

      • setEndOfDay

        public void setEndOfDay()
        The setEndOfDay method changes time part of the YFCDate to be hour = 23, minutes = 59 and seconds = 59 leaving milliseconds intact.

      • getYFCDate

        public static YFCDate getYFCDate(java.lang.String aStr)
        The getYFCDate creates a static YFCDate object from a string representing the date. aStr The input string date. A new YFCDate.

      • valueOf

        public static java.sql.Timestamp valueOf(java.lang.String s)

      • equals

        public boolean equals(YFCDate other)
        This method checks whether the YFCDate object point exactly to the same physical date. other YFCDate object. True if the YFCDate object points to the same physical date passed.

      • getDayOfMonth

        public int getDayOfMonth()
        This method returns the day of the month represented by the YFCDate. The day of the month represented by this YFCDate.

      • getMonth

        public int getMonth()
        The getMonth returns a number representing the month represented by this YFCDate object. For GregorianCalendar the value returned is between 0 and 11, with the value 0 representing the month of January. The month represented by this date.
        Overrides:
        getMonth in class java.util.Date

      • getFourDigitYear

        public int getFourDigitYear()
        This method returns the four digit year represented by this YFCDate. The year represented by the YFCDate.

      • getDayOfWeek

        public int getDayOfWeek()
        This method returns the day of the week represented by this YFCDate. In a GregorianCalendar , 1=Sunday, 2=Monday and so on. The day of the week represented by this YFCDate.

      • setOldXMLMode

        public static void setOldXMLMode()
        The setOldXMLMode method sets the XML mode to a old format and sets the backward compatibility mode to true.

      • isBCMode

        public static boolean isBCMode()
        This method checks for backward compatibility mode. The bcmode.
